p.s: Generally speaking the American Dream is something that gives hope and ambitions to American people.
Many people think that everybody and everything in America are able to be soccesfulsuccessful in America.
Because of that the question arises if there are no barriers to success in America.
From my point of view the mindset of everybody can do everything to be successful in America is not always right.
To begin with I want to state that it is possible to achieve great things in America even though you aren't an American.
For example Arnold Schwarzenegger came to America became a filmstar and a famous body builder.
He was really successful and he wasn't even an American.
If this is not the case for everyone in the American history.
They are a lot of people who could not get the chance to be succesfulsuccessful and get a nice life.
A good example for this is the Civil Rights Movement in which mostly black people fought for their rights and equality.
A lot of them were treated very bad and white people discriminated black people in all types of ways.
For example Malcolm X one of the big figures in their movement got shot during a speech he held.
Another important aspect is that not everyone is physically in the shape to dream bigh and become succesfulsuccessful.
For example disabled people who cantcan't even think for themselves.
This argument seems to be very important to me because this is a proof against the fact that there are no barriers to the American Dream.
All in all I think these arguments are really convincing because they show the fact that it is possible to be succesfulsuccessful but not everybody can make it in a very understandable way.
